item.value: Ok, but for Online 6 I see this parameter as true. I suppose that this parameter answers that on the auction page for lots, only the starting prices should be displayed. Those. do not display leading bids. Did I understand correctly?

I suppose that this parameter answers that on the auction page for lots, only the starting prices should be displayed. Those. do not display leading bids. Did I understand correctly?
Я верно понял?
I suppose that this parameter answers that on the auction page for lots, only the starting prices should be displayed. Those. do not display leading bids. I'm right?
I suppose that this parameter answers that on the auction page for lots, only the starting prices should be displayed. Those. do not display leading rates prices. I'm right?
Предполагаю что этот параметр отвечает что на странице аукциона для лотов надо отображать только стартовые цены. Т.е. не отображать цены ведущих ставок. Я прав?
I receive this parameter in response to a request for auctions / getAuctionInfo. And what is he responsible for? and what can you do with it?
Я получаю этот параметр в ответ на запрос auctions/getAuctionInfo. И за что он отвечает? и что с ним можно сделать?
some Code

Information about auctions (time, date, info etc) is stored both on bidspirit and on the auction house’s server. It will be managed manually in both environments. For convenience, there are 2 APIs which can be called from the server (auctions/getAllAuctions, auctions/getAuctionInfo) to synchronize the auction info.

Or I have a link to a tired version of the documentation. Could you help me clarify this point?

Мне поставили задачу оценить интеграцию функционала связанного с высовом API displayStartPriceInCatalog, но я не могу найти его в документации что бы понять какие параметры надо передавать и что из себя представляет эта API функция. Или я имею ссылку на уставшую версию документации. Не могли бы вы мне помочь разъяснить этот момент?
IgnoreUnsubscribeCheck–set true f or ignore blacklistcheck. (Contact customer support f or this option).
DelayInSeconds–Number of seconds of delay f rom receiving the request in the system and up to sending the message (use this parameteras long astheTimeToSend parameter is not in use).
TimeToSend–Date and time on which the messages will besent.Please use the f ollowing f ormat: dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm. If lef t blank, the message will be sent immediately.
MaxSegments–When sending long messages, this parameter allowsthe client to set the maximum number of segments per message. Value 0 means unlimited segments.
DeliveryNotificationUrl–Needed in order to send a conf irmation ondelivery to the client. The system will perf orm HTTPpost to this URL with notif ication inf ormation
MessageInterval-Sending messages with number of secondsinterval between them.The value 0means non-interval.

Priority–In order to prioritize your messages,you can use the priority tag,when 0 means normal priority, -1 high priority(used only f or a single message),and then1,2and so on. The higher the value,thelowerthepriority.
CustomerParameter–Parameter set by the clientthat can be seenin the reports, later. Can be used to mark each message by activity segmentation, f or example.
CustomerMessageID–Message IDon the client application. When conf irmation on delivery issent back to the client, the message IDis also sent f or synchronization
GroupNumber–Use this parameter in orderto send messagestoagroup according to the groupnumberdef ined inthe web site. To send a message tomultiple groupsplease usea semicolon";"
SavedMessageId–Send savedmessage in your account by id.(If you use this tag, don't use the Message tag)

Sender–The "Sender" f ield is restricted to a maximum of 11 Latin characters(Consecutive characters, no spaces) or 14 digits(no characters).You can also write an asterisk(*)at the beginning of the identif ier.
You code for login
Generate Login code for login user
If user code right - user will be redirected to My offers page If not - will see message “Wrong code”
System parts which will be managed by programmer

Stage 2 If the system has this phone or email - the user will be redirected to “Enter code screen” with “I didn’t receive the code button” which will resend the code. If not - user will get message “Email or phone not found in our system”

Stage 1 Client will enter the login screen and will write his phone or email. After submit - system will write random code to room_search.login_code and client will get code by email or sms. Code will be 6 digits.
After submit - system will write random code to room_search.login_code and client will get code by email or sms.
Client will enter the login screen and will write his phone or email.

Stage 1 Client will enter the login screen and will write his phone or email. After submit - system will write random code to room_search.login_code and client will get code by email or sms. Code will be 6 digits. Stage 2 If the system has this phone or email - the user will be redirected to “Enter code screen” with “I didn’t receive the code button” which will resend the code. If not - user will get message “Email or phone not found in our system” Stage 3 If user code right - user will be redirected to My offers page If not - will see message “Wrong code”
